newsitem.title: JAPAN: Chubu Electric's output down due to Toyota cut.
newsitem.headline: Chubu Electric's output down due to Toyota cut.

text.p: Chubu Electric Power Co Inc will cut its output by about 700,000 kilowatts (kw) on Wednesday due to a halt in production at Toyota Motor Corp's domestic plants, a Chubu spokeswoman said.
It will be the second consecutive day that output has been cut, she said.
The volume of the cut is about three percent of Chubu's average maximum power generation in winter, which is roughly 21.8 million kw, the company said in a statement.
A fire on February 1 at an Aisin Seiki Co Ltd plant halted output of some brake parts supplied to Toyota.
A Toyota spokesman said on Tuesday that the auto company will continue to suspend vehicle production on Wednesday at most of its domestic plants.

Toyota will resume output at some of its domestic production lines on Thursday and expects to resume near-normal levels of output at all domestic production lines on Friday, the Toyota spokesman said.
"We will be looking to Toyota to decide how we resume output," the Chubu spokeswoman said.
